#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=2. Proposed Solution
#Text=2.1. Overview of AmoebaNet Solution
#Text=We originally proposed AmoebaNet solution to support BigData Express ( BDE ) scientific application .
#Text=AmoebaNet project is currently ongoing evaluation and enhancement .
#Text=There are several design goals for AmoebaNet : ( 1 ) our primary goal is “ Network as a Service ” .
#Text=This feature provides a dynamic programmable networking services for scientific applications to achieve the optimum performance level of networks .
#Text=( 2 ) QoS-guaranteed service .
#Text=When applications require QoS guaranteed services for priority traffic , AmoebaNet must provide such types of services .
#Text=( 3 ) Wide applicability .
#Text=AmoebaNet has to provide a mechanism for wide applicability to support a wide range of applications other than scientific applications only . ( 4 )
#Text=It must be easily deployable and operable .
#Text=Followings are the salient features of AmoebaNet :
#Text=To provide a dynamic programmability feature for underlying network resources , AMQP interface was provided .
#Text=The JSON-RPC style based communication system of AMQP will allow an application to interact with the underlying networks in a flexible manner .
#Text=QoS-guaranteed path computation service along with route selection .
#Text=Provide “ Application-aware ” networking services .
#Text=Support differentiated service to ensure the required QoS services for priority traffic .
#Text=Provision the QoS-guaranteed network path between two ends with a fastest possible time .
#Text=REST-based network initialization and configuration .
#Text=Path resiliency .
#Text=Advanced reservation system .
#Text=Service locking/unlocking .
#Text=As shown in
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=, the architecture of AmoebaNet consists of several internal services that allow scientific applications ( such as BDE ) to program the underlying networks .
#Text=AmoebaNet is an enterprise network service and we integrated and tested this service along with the ESNet OSCARS ’s wide area network connection service .
#Text=It can promptly provision end-to-end QoS guaranteed network paths across the multiple scientific domains .
#Text=We implemented the AmoebaNet ’s service on top of the ONOS ( Open Network Operating System ) SDN controller and developed the entire application in Java language .
#Text=AmoebaNet successfully addressed the last mile , scalability , and dynamic programmability challenges for extreme-scale distributed scientific applications .
#Text=In order to address these challenges , AmoebaNet introduced the following key features :
#Text=By realizing network as a service , AmoebaNet supports various extreme-scale scientific applications and provides the rich and powerful set of dynamic programming primitives .
#Text=These dynamic programming primitives make it possible for scientific applications to program the networks in more flexible ways .
#Text=AmoebaNet also provides run-time programming capability for bulk data transfer , and utilizes the underlying network resources in an efficient and optimum way .
#Text=These supported features of AmoebaNet address the agility , automation , programmability challenges .
#Text=To address the last mile challenges , AmoebaNet provides a newly QoS-aware end-to-end bandwidth reservation feature .
#Text=It is a new rate enforcement mechanism by combining the meters and queuing based techniques and characterizes the traffic into two classes of services : best effort and priority .
#Text=AmoebaNet also has a feature of a new path computation service by using the largest bottleneck bandwidth algorithm .
#Text=In this mechanism the bandwidth can be considered as constraints and the best available paths between two end-points can be calculated .
#Text=To solve the scalability challenges of science networks , AmoebaNet uses the spoke-hub distribution model .
#Text=AmoebaNet at each site supports a hub-spoke distribution model for LAN or campus network .
#Text=It allows seamless integration of local networks and wide area networks .

#Text=When two systems are trying to send/receive the traffic to/from two physically isolated sites , then the service of AmoebaNet carefully identifies the corresponding p2p layer-2 circuits between sites and properly multiplexed and/or de-multiplexed the traffics accordingly .
#Text=AmoebaNet is able to provide a novel control plane logic , which consists of different sub-modules .
#Text=Each sub-module of control plane architecture is dedicated for a specific task and interacts with each other .

#Text=The entire control plane architecture is implemented inside ONOS SDN controller as a service and it uses north-bound and south-bound APIs to interact with applications and data plane , respectively .

#Text=To avoid the unsynchronized access and provides advanced reservation capability to network resources , we introduced the new locking/unlocking and scheduler mechanisms in AmoebaNet ’s solution .
#Text=The more detailed information about AmoebaNet can be found in for its design , implementation , and evaluation .
